raw: Coronavirus pandemic ruins outlook for a world of electric and autonomous cars .
replaced: Coronavirus pandemic ruins outlook for a world of electric and autonomous cars .

raw: With Detroit ’s Big Three automakers and Elon Musk ’s Tesla making ventilators to support the coronavirus pandemic relief effort , no doubt the shift to electronic and autonomous cars has suffered a major setback .

raw: For one , electric and hybrid cars are n’t being made right now as plants are shut down to support social distancing .
replaced: For one , electric and hybrid cars are n’t being made right now as plants are shut down to support social distancing .

raw: Who knows when auto production restarts .
replaced: Who knows when auto production restarts .

raw: Moreover , it ’s unclear what demand will be like for these often more expensive cars when consumers try to catch up on bills later this year after being laid off this spring .

raw: Meanwhile , automakers have temporarily halted investments in the technology designed to power the cars of the future ( not to mention a good chunk of their advertising for them ) .

raw: And last but not least , the plunge in oil prices — which has sent gas prices to below $ 1.00 a gallon in some parts of the country — makes it more attractive for people to own a car with a good old fashioned gas engine .

raw: Take all these factors together , and you see a vastly different road ahead for electric and autonomous cars looking out the next several years .
replaced: Take all these factors together , and you see a vastly different road ahead for electric and autonomous cars looking out the next several years .

raw: “ There has been a setback , ” TPG Global senior advisor and former Ford CEO Mark Fields said on Yahoo Finance ’s The First Trade .
